item.text: In the spring of the year, at the time when kings normally conduct wars, David sent out Joab with his officers and the entire Israelite army. They defeated the Ammonites and besieged Rabbah. But David stayed behind in Jerusalem.

<st data-num="01961" class="">One</st> <st data-num="06256 06153">evening</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="06965" class="">got up</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">from</st> his <st data-num="04904" class="">bed</st> and <st data-num="01980" class="">walked around</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="01406" class="">roof</st> of his <st data-num="01004 04428">palace</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="05921" class="">From</st> the <st data-num="01406" class="">roof</st> he <st data-num="07200" class="">saw</st> a <st data-num="0802" class="">woman</st> <st data-num="07364" class="">bathing</st>. Now this <st data-num="0802" class="">woman</st> was <st data-num="03966" class="">very</st> <st data-num="02896 04758">attractive</st>.<n id="2" />
So David sent someone to inquire about the woman. The messenger said, “Isn’t this Bathsheba, the daughter of Eliam, the wife of Uriah the Hittite?”

David sent some messengers to get her. She came to him and he went to bed with her. (Now at that time she was in the process of purifying herself from her menstrual uncleanness.) Then she returned to her home.
The woman conceived and then sent word to David saying, “I’m pregnant.”
So David sent a message to Joab that said, “Send me Uriah the Hittite.” So Joab sent Uriah to David.

When <st data-num="0223" class="">Uriah</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">came</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> him, <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="07592" class="">asked</st> about <st data-num="07965" class="">how</st> <st data-num="03097" class="">Joab</st> <st data-num="07965" class="">and</st> the <st data-num="05971" class="">army</st> were <st data-num="07965" class="">doing</st> and <st data-num="07965" class="">how</st> the <st data-num="04421" class="">campaign</st> was <st data-num="07965" class="">going</st>.<n id="1" />

Then <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to <st data-num="0223" class="">Uriah</st>, “<st data-num="03381" class="">Go down</st> to your <st data-num="01004" class="">home</st> and <st data-num="07364 07272">relax</st>.”<n id="1" /> When <st data-num="0223" class="">Uriah</st> <st data-num="03318" class="">left</st> the <st data-num="01004 04428">palace</st>, the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> <st data-num="03318" class="">sent</st> a <st data-num="04864" class="">gift</st> <st data-num="0310" class="">to</st> him.<n id="2" />
But Uriah stayed at the door of the palace with all the servants of his lord. He did not go down to his house.
So they informed David, “Uriah has not gone down to his house.” So David said to Uriah, “Haven’t you just arrived from a journey? Why haven’t you gone down to your house?”

<st data-num="0223" class="">Uriah</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">replied</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st>, “The <st data-num="0727" class="">ark</st> and <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> and <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> <st data-num="03427" class="">reside</st> in <st data-num="05521" class="">temporary shelters</st>, and my <st data-num="0113" class="">lord</st> <st data-num="03097" class="">Joab</st> and my <st data-num="0113" class="">lord’s</st> <st data-num="05650" class="">soldiers</st> are <st data-num="02583" class="">camping</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">in</st> the <st data-num="06440" class="">open</st> <st data-num="07704" class="">field</st>. Should <st data-num="0589" class="">I</st> <st data-num="0935" class="">go</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> my <st data-num="01004" class="">house</st> to <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st> and <st data-num="08354" class="">drink</st> and <st data-num="07901" class="">go to bed</st> <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st><n id="1" /> my <st data-num="0802" class="">wife</st>? As surely as you <st data-num="02416 02416 05315">are alive</st>,<n id="2" /> I will <st data-num="0518" class="">not</st> <st data-num="06213" class="">do</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">thing</st>!”

So <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="0223" class="">Uriah</st>, “<st data-num="03427" class="">Stay</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">here</st> <st data-num="01571" class="">another</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>. <st data-num="04279" class="">Tomorrow</st> I will <st data-num="07971" class="">send</st> you back.” So <st data-num="0223" class="">Uriah</st> <st data-num="03427" class="">stayed</st> in <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st> both <st data-num="01931" class="">that</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st> and the <st data-num="04283" class="">following one</st>.<n id="1" />
Then David summoned him. He ate and drank with him, and got him drunk. But in the evening he went out to sleep on his bed with the servants of his lord; he did not go down to his own house.
In the morning David wrote a letter to Joab and sent it with Uriah.
In the letter he wrote: “Station Uriah at the front in the thick of the battle and then withdraw from him so he will be cut down and killed.”
So as Joab kept watch on the city, he stationed Uriah at the place where he knew the best enemy soldiers were.
When the men of the city came out and fought with Joab, some of David’s soldiers fell in battle. Uriah the Hittite also died.
Then Joab sent a full battle report to David.

He <st data-num="06680" class="">instructed</st> the <st data-num="04397" class="">messenger</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">as follows</st>: “When you <st data-num="03615" class="">finish</st> <st data-num="01696" class="">giving</st> the <st data-num="04421" class="">battle</st> <st data-num="03605 01697">report</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st>,

<st data-num="01961 0518">if</st> the <st data-num="02534 04428">king</st> <st data-num="05927" class="">becomes angry</st> and <st data-num="0559" class="">asks</st> you, ‘<st data-num="04069" class="">Why</st> did you <st data-num="05066" class="">go</st> so <st data-num="05066" class="">close</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st> to <st data-num="03898" class="">fight</st>? <st data-num="03808" class="">Didn’t</st> you <st data-num="03045" class="">realize</st> they would <st data-num="0834 03384">shoot</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="02346" class="">wall</st>?

Who struck down Abimelech the son of Jerub-Besheth? Didn’t a woman throw an upper millstone down on him from the wall so that he died in Thebez? Why did you go so close to the wall?’ just say to him, ‘Your servant Uriah the Hittite is also dead.’”
So the messenger departed. When he arrived, he informed David of all the news that Joab had sent with him.

The <st data-num="04397" class="">messenger</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st>, “The <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> <st data-num="03588 01396 05921">overpowered</st> us and <st data-num="03318 0413">attacked</st> us<n id="1" /> in the <st data-num="07704" class="">field</st>. But we <st data-num="01961" class="">forced</st> them <st data-num="05921" class="">to retreat</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="05704" class="">all the way to</st> the <st data-num="06607" class="">door</st> of the city <st data-num="08179" class="">gate</st>.

Then the <st data-num="03384" class="">archers</st> <st data-num="03384" class="">shot</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">at</st> your <st data-num="05650" class="">servants</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="02346" class="">wall</st> and some of the <st data-num="04428" class="">king’s</st> <st data-num="05650" class="">soldiers</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="04191" class="">died</st>. Your <st data-num="05650" class="">servant</st> <st data-num="0223" class="">Uriah</st> the <st data-num="02850" class="">Hittite</st> <st data-num="04191" class="">is</st> <st data-num="01571" class="">also</st> <st data-num="04191" class="">dead</st>.”

David said to the messenger, “Tell Joab, ‘Don’t let this thing upset you. There is no way to anticipate whom the sword will cut down. Press the battle against the city and conquer it.’ Encourage him with these words.”
When Uriah’s wife heard that her husband Uriah was dead, she mourned for him.
When the time of mourning passed, David had her brought to his palace. She became his wife and she bore him a son. But what David had done upset the Lord.
